description: Shifts 2 places left when e.g.f. is squared.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Alois P. Heinz and Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..518 (first 200 terms from Alois P. Heinz)
M. Bernstein and N. J. A. Sloane, Some canonical sequences of integers, Linear Alg. Applications, 226-228 (1995), 57-72; erratum 320 (2000), 210.
maple: a:= proc(n) option remember;      `if`(n<2, 1, add(a(i)*a(n-2-i) *binomial(n-2, i), i=0..n-2))    end:seq(a(n), n=0..30);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 22 2012
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = If[n<2, 1, Sum[a[i]*a[n-2-i]*Binomial[n-2, i], {i, 0, n-2}]]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 30}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Feb 03 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)Round[CoefficientList[Series[6^(1/3) * WeierstrassP[(x + c)/6^(1/3), {0, -1/3}], {x, 0, 25}], x] * Range[0, 25]! /. FindRoot[6^(1/3)*WeierstrassP[c/6^(1/3), {0, -1/3}] == 1, {c, 8}, WorkingPrecision -> 1000]] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 14 2015 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
